content: beginner s stitch sampler scarf a scarf is composed of 6 inch sections each featuring a different popular stitch pattern a 3 stitch garter stitch border maintained throughout to prevent rolled edges 350 yards worsted weight wool blend yarn size us 8 needles cast on 30 stitches garter stitch section row 1 k30 repeat this row until section measures 6 inches stockinette section row 1 rs k30 row 2 ws k3 p24 k3 repeat these two row until section measures 6 inches basketweave section row 1-6 k7 p4 k4 p4 k4 p4 k3 row 7-12 k3 p4 k4 p4 k4 p4 k7 repeat row 1-12 until section measures 6 inches it is okay to stop after row 6 or after row 12 seed stitch section row 1 k3 k1 p1 repeat stitches in parentheses until 3 stitches remain k3 row 2 k3 p1 k1 repeat stitches in parentheses until 3 stitches remain k3 repeat these 2 row until section measures 6 inches smooth sand stitch section row 1 rs k3 k1 p1 repeat stitches in parentheses until 3 stitches remain k3 row 2 ws k3 p24 k3 repeat these 2 row until section measures 6 inches ribbed stitch section k7 p4 k4 p4 k4 p4 k3 repeat this row until section measures 6 inches the ribbed stitch is the half-way point on the scarf after knitting this 6 inch section repeat each previous section working in reverse smooth sand seed basketweave stockinette and lastly garter finishing wet block using blocking wires or straight pins to ensure a straight/non-rolled edge
